title: 106_hr2309
content: The Act may be cited as the "Independent Medical Review Act of 1999" and includes special rules for group health plans. Section 503 of ERISA is amended to include special rules for group health plans, such as notification of appeal rights to utilization review agents and independent review organizations. The amendment to Section 503 of ERISA includes rules for group health plans regarding notification of appeal rights to utilization review agents and independent review organizations, ensuring fair and timely review processes for participants and beneficiaries. The amendment to Section 503 of ERISA outlines procedures for appealing adverse determinations to a utilization review agent, including options for oral or written appeals and requirements for documentation submission within 5 working days. The amendment to Section 503 of ERISA outlines procedures for appealing adverse determinations to a utilization review agent, including options for oral or written appeals, a requirement for documentation submission within 5 working days, and provisions for appeal decisions to be made by a physician, with a method for expedited appeals for emergency care denials. The expedited appeal procedure for emergency care denials, life-threatening conditions, and denials of continued stays for hospitalized patients includes a review by a healthcare provider of the same specialty. The appeal must be completed within one working day based on the immediacy of the medical condition. After seeking review, the utilization review agent must issue a response letter explaining the resolution of the appeal. The utilization review agent must issue a response letter to the patient, explaining the resolution of the appeal within 30 days. If the appeal is denied, the participant can seek review from an independent organization. A participant can seek review of an adverse determination from an independent review organization. The independent review process ensures timely responses, confidentiality of medical records, independence of healthcare providers, and timely notice of results to the participant. The utilization review agent must provide relevant medical records and documents to the independent review organization within 3 business days of receiving a request for review of an adverse determination. The participant should also receive written notification indicating the clinical basis for the denial of the appeal. The independent review organization must make a determination within 15 days of receiving necessary information, including medical records, documentation, and a list of relevant healthcare providers. The independent review organization must make a determination within specific timeframes based on the urgency of the medical condition. For non-life-threatening conditions, the determination must be made within 15 days of receiving necessary information. For life-threatening conditions, the determination must be made within 5 days of receiving the required information. The independent review organization must make determinations within specific timeframes based on the urgency of the medical condition. To be certified as an independent review organization, an organization must submit an annual application to the Secretary. The applicant, if publicly held, must disclose stockholders with more than 5% ownership, business affiliations, bond holders over $100,000, and biographical information of directors and executives. Additionally, any relationships with health insurance providers must be disclosed. The curr_chunk describes the relationships individuals have with various entities in the healthcare industry, the percentage of revenues from reviews, and the expertise of healthcare professionals. The curr_chunk outlines the procedures and expertise required for reviews conducted under this subsection, with determinations by an independent review organization being binding on the plan unless vacated or modified by a court. The curr_chunk explains that an independent review entity's determination can be vacated or modified by a court, and outlines requirements for independence and waiver of liability. Definitions include "adverse determination" as a finding of medically unnecessary services by a health plan or utilization review agent. The curr_chunk defines terms like "health care provider" as individuals or entities delivering health services, and "life-threatening condition" as a medical issue with potential for death or serious harm. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms like "payor" as entities providing health benefits and "utilization review agent" as entities conducting reviews for employers or insurers. The curr_chunk defines "review agent" as an entity conducting utilization review for employers, payors, or administrators, and "working day" as a weekday excluding legal holidays.
